bibl.title: Ancient Alexandria between Egypt and Greece

bibl.seg: BIRNBAUM Ellen, Portrayals of the Wise and Virtuous in Alexandrian Jewish Works: Jews' Perceptions of Themselves and Others.
William V. HARRIS and Giovanni RUFFINI (Edd.), Ancient Alexandria between Egypt and Greece = Columbia Studies in the Classical Tradition. 26 (Leiden, 2004) pp. 125-160.

Examines how 3 Alexandrian sources - the Letter of Aristeas, the Wisdom of Solomon, and the works of Philo - portray wise and good people in relation to Jews and non-Jews as well as how these sources speak of Jews and non-Jews in general.
